children.text: The sarking that has been installed under the roofing is short to the gutter, which will allow the condensation that collects over it from the underside of the roof to run down onto the ceiling, brickwork and eave linings.
The relevant Australian Standard AS 4200.2 Pliable Building Membranes and Underlays Part 2: Installation Requirements, requires that
‘a pliable building membrane (sarking) shall be lapped not less than 150mm at all joins’ and
‘pliable building membrane shall be installed in a manner which will ensure it can drain into eaves gutters any water which it collects’ and
‘penetrations shall be either sealed or turned up to facilitate drainage around a penetration’ .
The installation of the present sarking must be rectified in accordance with the above requirements.
